intro: Hybanthus bicolor var. genuinus, commonly known as the two-colored hybanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Violaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its strikingly contrasting white and purple flowers, which bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
